newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Sept 9.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Sept 9.

text.p: -- Revco DS Inc said it will launch a $330 million bid, or $15 a share, for Big B Inc. Big B shares closed at 12-5/8 Friday. Revco closed at 25-5/8.

-- DII Group said a slowdown in orders at its DOVatron International unit will cut second-half revenues by about $40 million and fully-diluted earnings per share by some $0.35. DII closed off 3-1/8 to 23.
-- Datalogix International said it expects to post a loss of $0.69 to $0.73 a share for the fiscal year ended June 30. It closed at 6-1/4.
-- Vallicorp said it is in preliminary merger talks with an unidentified bank holding company. Vallicorp closed at 18-1/8.
-- Jennifer Convertibles said its accountant will not express an opinion on its financial statements for fiscal 1994 and 1995. Jennifer closed at 2-1/4.
-- Northon McNaughton posted third quarter profits of $0.08 a share, down from $0.28 a year earlier. It closed at 7-7/8.

-- Biovail Corp could give short sellers a jolt if it grows, and one analyst said Polaris Industries Inc is still set for future earnings growth despite the battering the stock took last week, according to the financial weekly Barron's.
Biovail closed at 27 on Friday and Polaris closed at 23. Polaris lost 3/8 on Friday and touched a new year low of 22-1/8 during the session.
